attribute.name: style
attribute.description: The style to use for this div.

attribute.name: styleClass
attribute.description: The class to use for this div.

attribute.name: backgroundColor
attribute.description: Background color to give the corners. Leave blank (null) to have a transparent background. If the user is using IE6, this has to be set, or the corners will not look good due to IE6's lack of PNG support.

attribute.name: borderColor
attribute.description: The color of the border. If specified, this will cause the DIV to be 2D, if it isn't the border with have a 3D effect with lighting effects to produce the border color.

attribute.name: borderWidth
attribute.description: The width of the border in pixels. (Default: 8)

attribute.name: color
attribute.description: The foreground color of the DIV

attribute.name: corners
attribute.description: This allows you to specify a comma-separated list of corners to include. If not given, all four corners will be rendered. The corners include the sides they touch. So for example, if used as a tab for a tabbed pane, you could specify "topleft,topright" to have everything but the bottom corners and side have the border. Valid values are: topleft, topright, bottomright, bottomleft

attribute.name: radius
attribute.description: The radius of the corners in pixels. (Default: 8)

attribute.name: size
attribute.description: If given, a static size image will be produced. This could be useful for older browsers. If not given, the DIV that will be created will stretch to its contents using CSS2 (and CSS expressions in IE6). Value must contain two numbers, with width first. Example: 640x480

attribute.name: inverse
attribute.description: Flips the lightening/darkening effect for 3D borders. (Default: false)

attribute.name: layout
attribute.description: Either "table" or "div". Specifies how the output should be rendered. Size must be null if using "table" (if it is not, a div will be rendered). (Default: div)

attribute.name: contentStyle
attribute.description: The CSS style to give to the content DIV or TD (based on layout)

attribute.name: contentStyleClass
attribute.description: The CSS style class to give to the content DIV or TD (based on layout)
